business.headline: Expert explains why your 12% equity returns aren't realMost people believe a 12% equity return is strong growth, but according to an expert, the actual gain after inflation and taxes is much smaller. Here's why your money may not be growing as much as you think.
Fresh ED summons to Anil Ambani in fraud case after he skips second dateIn a continued push to seek clarity in the ongoing investigation, the ED has served another notice to Anil Ambani.
Sensex, Nifty bounce back after volatile day as markets cheer Bihar winThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 84.11 points to close at 84,562.78, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.90 points to end at 25,910.05.

Why safety worries are growing for India's top executivesThe report shows that 71% of corporate security chiefs in India believe the risk of violence against chief executives has increased in the last two years, marking the highest level recorded globally.

Using BNPL regularly? Your salary may be hiding an invisible debt trapHaving easy access to credit at the tap of your finger via BNPL feels convenient, but could those small pay-later purchases be quietly building into a debt trap that only shows up on payday?

From SSY to FDs: 3 smart investment schemes every parent should knowPlanning for a child's future requires wise financial choices. From government-backed savings to bank deposits, these three investments offer stability and dependable returns for parents.

Verizon to slash 15% of workforce. What's driving the massive cuts?The telecom giant has been under pressure as rivals AT&T and T-Mobile continue to offer cheaper plans and aggressive promotions, especially during the launch of new iPhone models.

Bars, coins or digital: How Indians are buying gold differently after prices crossed Rs 1 lakhFor the first time, gold breached the psychological barrier of Rs 1 lakh, a milestone that once seemed out of reach. Until that point, conversations around gold were filled with speculation: "Will gold really touch one lakh?" But once that threshold was crossed, the sentiment changed entirely.

Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 1: Check latest GMP and subscription statusCapillary operates in the AI-led SaaS and customer loyalty solutions space, serving more than 410 brands across 47 countries. The company turned profitable in FY25 after two years of losses, reporting Rs 14.15 crore in profit. Revenue increased to Rs 598 crore in FY25.

Pine Labs shares list at 10% premium: Should you hold or book profit now?Pine Labs' better-than-expected debut and strong institutional support boosted early sentiment, but analysts say elevated valuations and intense fintech competition mean investors should balance listing-day gains with disciplined, long-term positioning.

Can a daughter's name be removed from pension records? Government explainsSeveral departments had asked whether a daughter's name should be removed from the family list after an employee retires. To settle the confusion, the DoP&PW issued an Office Memorandum clearly stating that her name must stay in the records.

Adani Group to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh: ReportSpeaking at a state event on Friday, Karan Adani said the investments are aimed at expanding the conglomerate's infrastructure footprint in the southern state and strengthening its long-term presence in high-growth sectors.

Sagility share price jumps over 6% today. What's driving the rally?Sagility's shares jumped after a large block deal hit the tape, with buyers overpowering supply. The stock's sharp rise suggests traders are betting the stake sale won't derail its near-term momentum.
Pine Labs share price: Stock lists at 10% premium over IPO pricePine Labs shares opened at Rs 242 on the BSE and NSE. The listing performance was slightly better than grey market expectations.

Infosys, TCS, TechM, HCLTech down: Why are IT stocks falling today?At the opening bell, major IT names fell sharply. Infosys dropped 1.91%, Tech Mahindra slipped 0.66%, HCLTech fell 0.29%, and TCS declined 0.36%.

entertainment.headline: In Your Dreams review: Netflix serves up a warm, dreamy, feel-good storyRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 In Your Dreams movie review: Netflix's animated film is a heartwarming story of a brother-sister duo out on a dreamy adventure to ensure their 'family stay together, happily'.

SRK launches first-ever property named after him: My mother would have been proud Shah Rukh Khan launched the first-ever property named after him. He was also accompanied by choreographer Farah Khan at the grand event.

Tere Ishk Mein trailer: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon unleash love's madness, heartbreak The trailer of Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's much-awaited film 'Tere Ishk Mein' is finally out. Directed by Aanand L Rai, the film is slated to release on November 28.

Michelle Yeoh to receive Honourary Golden Bear at Berlinale Palast 2026 Actor Michelle Yeoh will receive the Honorary Golden Bear at the 2026 Berlinale for her outstanding film career. This recognition highlights her impact on global cinema and marks a historic milestone for Asian artists.

Saiyaara gets Popular Choice Award at Yellowstone International Film Festival 2025 Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, continues its winning streak by bagging the Popular Choice Award at the Yellowstone International Film Festival 2025. With Rs 570 crore worldwide earnings and a historic Billboard Top 10 track, the romantic drama stands as one of Indian cinema's most celebrated love stories.

Kajol jokes she wishes to shrink Yug and Nysa, celebrates Children's Day Kajol shared adorable pictures with Yug and Nysa Devgn on Children's Day. She offered a lighthearted perspective on parenting, saying can we just shrink them? Check out the post here.

Smriti Mandhana, Palash Muchhal's wedding card reportedly goes viral. See pic A wedding card is circulating on social media featuring the names of Palash Muchhal and Smriti Mandhana. This has led to widespread rumours about their upcoming nuptials.

Millie Bobby Brown snaps at paps for asking her to smile at Stranger Things event Millie Bobby Brown confronted photographers who told her to smile at the Stranger Things Season 5 London premiere. The exchange went viral, sparking mixed reactions among fans and on social media.

Inspection Bungalow review: Flashes of fun in an uneven horror-comedyRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 'Inspection Bunglow', the Zee 5 horror-comedy series, arrives with an intriguing setup and a cast willing to play along, but the writing and execution never fully rise to the potential of its premise.

Kareena Kapoor shares her bits and bobs of life in new post. See here Kareena Kapoor Khan delighted fans by sharing candid "bits and bobs" from her personal and work life, including family moments, set glimpses, and an adorable video with son Jeh. The actor is also gearing up for her upcoming Netflix documentary 'Dining with the Kapoors' and the shoot of Meghna Gulzar's crime-drama 'Daayra'.

European Union Film Festival curator Artur on Mira Nair, Payal Kapadia and India European Union Film Festival curator Artur Zaborski reflects on his love for Indian cinema, Mira Nair, 'The Lunchbox', 'All We Imagine As Light', in an exclusive interview with India Today. He also spoke about bridging the gap between India and the European Union.

Sayani Gupta on playing Kusum in Delhi Crime 3: Wrote my own dialogues Actor Sayani Gupta shared insights on how she shaped her character in 'Delhi Crime 3'. The actor revealed that she improvised most of her scenes and wrote her own dialogues.

Bigg Boss 19: Ashnoor Kaur talks of sacrifices her mother made for her career Actor Ashnoor Kaur, during a live conversation in the 'Bigg Boss 19' house, reflected on her journey in the entertainment industry and spoke about the pivotal role her mother played in supporting her career from a young age.

De De Pyaar De 2 X review: Fans praise Ajay-Rakul's age-gap romance for its humour Director Anshul Sharma's romantic-comedy 'De De Pyaar De 2' was praised by X users. The film features actors Ajay Devgn, Rakul Preet Singh, R Madhavan, Gautami Kapoor, Javed Jafferi and Meezaan Jafri in pivotal characters.

Tabu stuns as showstopper in Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla's fashion show. Pics Actor Tabu closed the show for designers Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla at Art Mumbai, drawing attention for her commanding runway presence and a dramatic black ensemble.

Salman Khan prays for Dharmendra's speedy recovery Salman Khan expressed deep admiration for Dharmendra during a recent event, highlighting the veteran actor's impact on his fitness journey. He even prayed for his speedy recovery.

Kamini Kaushal's special connection with Dharmendra revealed. Read here Kamini Kaushal, who died at the age of 98, had a special connection with Dharmendra. Bollywood's original He-Man revealed the connection in an Instagram post he shared a few years ago.

Akshay Kumar, Ahmed Khan's BTS moment from Welcome To The Jungle wins the internet Akshay Kumar's fun BTS moment with director Ahmed Khan from 'Welcome To The Jungle' has gone viral, giving fans a lively glimpse of the film's energetic set.

general news.headline: Blast at Srinagar police station that was probing terror module, casualties fearedA powerful blast rocked South Srinagar's Nowgam police station, igniting a massive fire and causing major damage. Vehicles burned, the building suffered heavily, and casualties are feared as officials assess the scene.

NDA'S MY formula in, Opposition's communal MY formula out: PM on Bihar landslidePrime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated the National Democratic Alliance's historic victory in the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, praising the people of Bihar for their resounding mandate. The win is seen as a strong endorsement of development politics and a rejection of divisive tactics by the opposition.

Election wasn't fair from the beginning: Rahul Gandhi after Congress' Bihar drubbingCalling the Bihar verdict a setback that warrants introspection, Gandhi said the Congress and the INDIA bloc would "deeply review" the results and strengthen their efforts going forward.

Assam Minister's 'Bihar approves Gobi farming' shocker after NDA landslideThe Assam Minister's post on NDA's Bihar win left social media users in disbelief over the sheer reference to the brutal Logain massacre.

Video: With gamcha in hand, PM enters BJP office to celebrate Bihar landslideAfter a resounding win for the NDA in the Bihar Assembly elections, Prime Minister Narendra Modi entered the BJP headquarters in Delhi to a rousing welcome in grand fashion on Friday evening.

Tagore wanted two stanzas of Vande Mataram, Gandhi compared chant to Allahu AkbarVande Mataram represents the soul of India's freedom struggle. However, its provocative use as a slogan at times made Mahatma Gandhi equate it with Allahu Akbar. Despite the opposition from a section of Muslims, Congress leaders knew there couldn't be a better National Song. It was Rabindranath Tagore who separated two stanzas from the six others, and endorsed it as the National Song.

Kidnappings, rapes, guns: Bihar jungle raj stories flood X after RJD poll routBihar elections: From kidnapping threats to goons roaming with guns, several natives from Bihar, mostly 90s kids, flooded social media with their personal memories of jungle raj during Lalu Prasad's reign as the NDA secured an emphatic victory.

Congress set for a split, says PM Modi after NDA's Bihar landslideAddressing BJP workers in Delhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that members within the Congress have grown discontented with what he called the "Muslim League Maoist Congress," predicting another split in the party.

Viral: UP rape survivor pushes past cops, runs to senior officer to plead her caseA gang-rape survivor in UP defied police obstruction to meet the DIG, demanding swift arrest of the remaining accused, in a video that has gone viral.

Revanth Reddy wins big, breaching the BRS citadel in Jubilee HillsAfter three successive electoral defeats in the Jubilee Hills assembly constituency - 2014, 2018 and 2023 - the Congress managed to storm the goalpost in the by-election whose result was announced on Friday.

Bill to end H-1B visa programme soon, says Republican CongresswomanRepublican Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene said she would be introducing a bill to end the H-1B visa programme, claiming US companies were misusing it to replace American workers. Her proposal would phase out the programme, with a temporary 10,000-visa exemption for medical professionals.

A mocking Yashwant Sinha gets Bihar results bang onVeteran politician and BJP rebel Yashwant Sinha's sarcastic tweet has become an accidental political prophecy in Bihar Assembly elections. Three days before Bihar poll results, he "predicted" an NDA sweep—and the alliance actually crossed 200 seats. The 88-year-old's post has now gone viral.

SRK launches first-ever property named after him: My mother would have been proudShah Rukh Khan launched the first-ever property named after him. He was also accompanied by choreographer Farah Khan at the grand event.
At least 6 dead as bus crashes into stop in StockholmThe incident occurred near the Royal Institute of Technology university in Stockholm.

Farsh par is fantastic for Prashant KishorPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj being "farsh par" doesn't mean failure. It's the ground where PK can rebuild, reconnect, and reimagine Bihar politics. Keeping the dust of defeat behind, Jan Suraaj now has a foundation of hope, recognition, and the beginnings of a loyal voter base to soar from.

How an NDA's superstar is hiding in plain sightWith the NDA's landslide victory, the spotlight is on its bigger constituents, like the BJP, the JDU and the LJP. Amid the spotlight on the bigger parties, NDA constituent Jitan Ram Manjhi-led Hindustani Awam Morcha (HAM) has won five out of the six seats he contested, registering an impressive strike rate. This is why former Bihar CM Manjhi is the NDA's secret superstar.

Flash on, laalten gone: Union Minister recreates PM's viral call after NDA winThe moment wasn't random. At an election rally in Bihar's Samastipur last month, PM Modi had launched a sharp attack on the RJD, whose symbol is the lantern, declaring that the state no longer needs "lanterns and their allies."

Bihar rocked today, makhana kheer in every home tonight: PM in victory speechIn his victory speech, the PM hailed the landslide majority as the victory of the developmental politics orchestrated by both Janata Dal (United) chief Nitish Kumar and the Central government. He also took a sharp jibe at the Mahagathbandhan over its abysmal performance in Bihar.

Omar Abdullah's big loss of face, party loses seat he vacated after state pollsThe National Conference lost Budgam, the seat Chief Minister Omar Abdullah vacated in the 2024 elections after he also won the Ganderbal seat.

XUV 700 loses control on Delhi-Mumbai Expressway, plunges into ditch; 5 deadThe accident occurred around 7 am on Friday near Bhimpura village. The vehicle, registered as MHO3 EL 1388, was travelling from Delhi towards Gujarat when the driver reportedly lost control.

Not property or stocks, can investing in luxury be the next big move for India's middle class?Can the Indian middle class move beyond traditional options like fixed deposits and mutual funds, and start viewing luxury goods as a serious investment?

Why Chirag Paswan is NDA's Ravindra JadejaFinisher Ravindra Jadeja does it with the bat. LJP (RV) leader Chirag Paswan has done it with seats. After the 100% strike rate in the Lok Sabha polls, Chirag Paswan's party is set to deliver a hit in the final overs of the Bihar Election 2025. Leading in 23 seats of the 29 it contested, Chirag's party doesn't just have a good strike rate, it has helped the NDA's tally with vote transfers.

De De Pyaar De 2 review: Bumpy but breezy Bollywood rom-com that does the jobRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025'De De Pyaar De 2' is a fun, breezy rom-com that combines humour, family drama and familiar charm. The casting is awkward, but the film doesn't disappoint.

OnePlus 15 review in 9 points: Big performance, bigger battery, but is it enough?The OnePlus 15 is now available for purchase in India, but are you confused about whether it is the ultimate flagship phone that you should buy in 2025? We have made your buying decision easier by summarising our detailed review in 9 points. We talk about its design, gaming performance, display quality, camera experience and more.

sports.headline: Babar Azam ends 807-day century drought, equals Saeed Anwar's ODI record Babar Azam ended his 807-day century drought with an unbeaten 102 against Sri Lanka in the 2nd ODI in Rawalpindi. His innings helped Pakistan chase down 289 and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Wrestling body lifts suspension of Olympic medallist Aman for missing weight The Wrestling Federation of India has lifted the suspensions of Aman Sehrawat and Neha Sangwan for weight violations. This decision allows them to enter the Pro Wrestling League auction, but warns of stricter action for any future lapses.

IND vs SA: Kagiso Rabada's availability remains uncertain for 2nd Test Kagiso Rabada remains a doubtful starter for the second Test against India after missing the series opener due to a rib injury. South Africa are awaiting further medical assessments to determine his availability.

Tough self-judge? Vaibhav Suryavanshi rates his 42-ball 144 out of 100 Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi lit up Doha with a stunning 42-ball 144, but the 14-year-old wasn't fully satisfied. Even after one of the biggest knocks of his young career, he rated it with striking honesty and restraint.

No magic, just mastery: Jasprit Bumrah on dismantling South Africa in Kolkata Test India vs South Africa, 1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah turned a dry Eden Gardens pitch into his stage, ripping through South Africa with a superb five-for. After silencing fitness critics, he reminded everyone that his craft isn't magic but pure skill, patience and relentless accuracy.

South Africa coach plays down Jasprit Bumrah's 'bauna' remark for Temba Bavuma South Africa batting coach Ashwell Prince has dismissed concerns over Jasprit Bumrah's on-field remark about Temba Bavuma during the opening day of the first Test at Eden Gardens. Prince clarified that the team will not discuss the incident, while no complaint will be made regarding the exchange captured on the stump mic.

Mohammed Shami set to be traded to Lucknow Super Giants for IPL 2026: Report India and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Mohammed Shami is set to be traded to Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) for Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026). Shami was bought for Rs 10 Crore at IPL 2025 mega auction but failed to live up to his reputation.

Control your temptation: Jasprit Bumrah's guide to acing tricky Eden Gardens pitch India vs South Africa, 1st Test: After claiming a sensational five-wicket haul, Jasprit Bumrah explained why it isn't easy for fast bowlers to find success on a dry pitch like the one at Eden Gardens on Day 1 of the series opener in Kolkata.

Hardik Pandya kept in touch, motivated me: Allah Ghazanfar hopes to be retained by MI AM Ghazanfar, Afghanistan's 19-year-old mystery spinner, reflects on a demanding year and looks ahead to potential retention by the Mumbai Indians for the 2026 IPL season.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: DC eye reset in overseas combination, pace unit As the Delhi Capitals gear up for IPL 2026, they will be eager to address some glaring weaknesses in their squad ahead of the mini-auction. An overhaul of the overseas opening slot and a reset in the fast-bowling department will be among their top priorities. With the 15 November deadline approaching, here's a probable list of players DC are expected to retain.

Jasprit Bumrah's name also gets him wickets, not just his accuracy: Dale Steyn Legendary South Africa fast bowler Dale Steyn feels Jasprit Bumrah's name also plays a major role in him getting wickets. The India fast bowler dismantled South Africa with a five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the first Test at Eden Gardens

Shami was bought for Rs 10 Crore at IPL 2025 mega auction but failed to live up to his reputation.

An overhaul of the overseas opening slot and a reset in the fast-bowling department will be among their top priorities. With the 15 November deadline approaching, here's a probable list of players DC are expected to retain.

At 14, Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashes 32-ball hundred in Rising Stars Asia CupAsia Cup Rising Stars 2025: Vaibhav Suryavanshi brought up his second T20 hundred, this time in 32 balls. The left-handed batter shone for India A in their opening match of the tournament against the UAE In Doha on Friday, November 14.

Asia Cup Rising Stars live streaming: When and where to watch India A vs UAE online in IndiaAsia Cup Rising Stars 2025 live streaming and TV telecast guide: India A, led by Jitesh Sharma, have won the toss and opted to bat in their opening match against the UAE at West End Park International Cricket Stadium in Doha.

Kolkata Test: Bumrah rediscovers mojo on dry pitch, razes South Africa on Day 1IND vs SA, Kolkata Test Day 1: Jasprit Bumrah roared back to top gear with a fiery five-wicket haul that dismantled South Africa for 159, setting up a commanding position for India on a dramatic opening day at Eden Gardens.

Bumrah emulates Dale Steyn with menacing spell against South Africa in KolkataJasprit Bumrah delivered a stunning five-wicket haul on Day 1 of the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens. Courtesy of his spell, South Africa were bundled out for 159 in their first innings.

Bangladesh hammer Ireland by an innings and 47 runs in SylhetBangladesh recorded a dominant win over Ireland inside four days in Sylhet, thanks to Hasan Murad's four wickets and centuries from Mahmudul Hasan Joy and captain Najmul Hossain Shanto. Despite resistance from Andy McBrine and Andy Balbirnie, Ireland fell short by an innings and 47 runs.

Hockey India announce squad for Jr. World Cup 2025, Rohit named captainHockey India has unveiled the Indian Junior Men's Team for the upcoming FIH Junior World Cup, with defender Rohit named captain. The squad will compete in Pool B, but will miss key forward Araijeet Singh Hundal due to injury.

Tim Southee joins KKR as 3-time champions continue coaching revampIPL 2026: Kolkata Knight Riders have appointed Tim Southee as their new bowling coach for the next season. The former New Zealand bowler will join a new-look support staff, led by Abhishek Nayar.

Bangladesh hammer Ireland by an innings and 47 runs in SylhetBangladesh recorded a dominant win over Ireland inside four days in Sylhet, thanks to Hasan Murad's four wickets and centuries from Mahmudul Hasan Joy and captain Najmul Hossain Shanto. Despite resistance from Andy McBrine and Andy Balbirnie, Ireland fell short by an innings and 47 runs.

Hockey India announce squad for Jr. World Cup 2025, Rohit named captainHockey India has unveiled the Indian Junior Men's Team for the upcoming FIH Junior World Cup, with defender Rohit named captain. The squad will compete in Pool B, but will miss key forward Araijeet Singh Hundal due to injury.

Tim Southee joins KKR as 3-time champions continue coaching revampIPL 2026: Kolkata Knight Riders have appointed Tim Southee as their new bowling coach for the next season. The former New Zealand bowler will join a new-look support staff, led by Abhishek Nayar.

Was begging for Mohammed Shami when I was SRH bowling coach: Dale SteynDale Steyn said that he was eager to get Mohammed Shami to SRH when he was working as the bowling coach of the franchise. Shami is being linked with a move away from SRH ahead of the IPL 2026 retentions.

Lakshya Sen stuns former world champion Loh Kean Yow to reach Japan Masters semisLakshya Sen secured a straight-games win over former world champion Loh Kean Yew to advance to the semifinals at the Kumamoto Masters Japan 2025. The Indian shuttler held off a late challenge from Loh, winning 21-13, 21-17 to set up a match against Japan's Kenta Nishimoto.

Bauna bhi hai: Bumrah's LBW chat with Pant on stump mic for Bavuma goes viralJasprit Bumrah's chat with Rishabh Pant about Temba Bavuma's height has gone viral. The incident occurred in the 13th over when Bumrah thought he had trapped the Proteas skipper in front of the stumps.

Watch: Ex-Spanish football chief Luis Rubiales pelted with eggs during book launchLuis Rubiales' book launch in Madrid turned chaotic when his uncle threw eggs at him, adding drama to a year marked by his conviction for the non-consensual kiss on Jenni Hermoso and a sweeping scandal that reshaped Spanish football.

On Paris attacks anniversary, France restrict World Cup qualification celebrationsFrance qualified for the 2026 World Cup after a 4-0 victory over Ukraine, but the team kept post-match celebrations minimal in recognition of the 10th anniversary of the November 13, 2015 attacks in Paris.

End of the road for Sai Sudharsan? No.3 spot can't be a musical chairs game, says ChopraAakash Chopra has slammed the decision to drop Sai Sudharsan from the playing XI for the Kolkata Test. Sudharsan was dropped from the game despite scoring an impressive 87 in the second Test against the West Indies.

Shubman Gill laughs off toss woes, says he's saving his luck for the WTC finalIND vs SA, 1st Test Day 1: Shubman Gill brushed off another lost toss with a WTC final quip but said India's 'very hungry' Test side is ready for a strong start in South Africa, banking on early movement for pacers and key changes in the XI.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
